caption: Model Inference Pipeline Architecture.
llama_insight: illustrates the model inference pipeline architecture used in our study. The input features consist of borrower characteristics such as credit score, debt-to-income ratio, property value, and other relevant variables. These inputs are fed into a neural network classifier which outputs a predicted probability of default for each observation.
llava_insight: presents a pipeline architecture for model inference in a scientific study related to predicting probability distribution for next-month default status. The study utilizes Freddie Mac's single-family mortgage monthly performance data spanning from 2012 to 2022. The pipeline architecture is composed of three main stages: 1) Sequences (Chosen Time Window and Feature Set), 2) Logistic Regression (Class-Weighted Random Forest, Tuned & Balanced LSTM, and Transformer), and 3) Cold-Start Handling: Early Observations, Market Benchmarks & Origin Attributes.

dual_analysis.text_only_analysis: illustrates the model inference pipeline architecture used in our study. The input features consist of borrower characteristics such as credit score, debt-to-income ratio, property value, and other relevant variables. These inputs are fed into a neural network classifier which outputs a predicted probability of default for each observation.
dual_analysis.vision_enhanced_analysis: presents a pipeline architecture for model inference in a scientific study related to predicting probability distribution for next-month default status. The study utilizes Freddie Mac's single-family mortgage monthly performance data spanning from 2012 to 2022. The pipeline architecture is composed of three main stages: 1) Sequences (Chosen Time Window and Feature Set), 2) Logistic Regression (Class-Weighted Random Forest, Tuned & Balanced LSTM, and Transformer), and 3) Cold-Start Handling: Early Observations, Market Benchmarks & Origin Attributes.

caption: Model Performance
llama_insight: demonstrates how different types of machine learning algorithms perform when predicting whether a person will default on their home loan based on historical information about them such as credit score, income level etc. The x axis shows the number of years of data used to train each algorithm while y axis shows the accuracy of those predictions. We can see that more complex models like neural networks outperform simpler ones even though they require less training time but also need much larger datasets to achieve good results.
llava_insight: is a set of four line graphs, each representing the performance of a model in predicting mortgage delinquency across different time windows and feature sets. The key scientific insight from the figure is that the performance of the model in predicting mortgage delinquency improves as the time window for data analysis increases, with the 10-year window showing the best performance. This finding relates to the research objectives by demonstrating the importance of considering a longer time window for data analysis in predicting mortgage delinquency, which could be useful for financial institutions and regulators in making informed decisions related to mortgage lending and risk management.

dual_analysis.text_only_analysis: demonstrates how different types of machine learning algorithms perform when predicting whether a person will default on their home loan based on historical information about them such as credit score, income level etc. The x axis shows the number of years of data used to train each algorithm while y axis shows the accuracy of those predictions. We can see that more complex models like neural networks outperform simpler ones even though they require less training time but also need much larger datasets to achieve good results.
dual_analysis.vision_enhanced_analysis: is a set of four line graphs, each representing the performance of a model in predicting mortgage delinquency across different time windows and feature sets. The key scientific insight from the figure is that the performance of the model in predicting mortgage delinquency improves as the time window for data analysis increases, with the 10-year window showing the best performance. This finding relates to the research objectives by demonstrating the importance of considering a longer time window for data analysis in predicting mortgage delinquency, which could be useful for financial institutions and regulators in making informed decisions related to mortgage lending and risk management.

caption: In-Sample Variance Estimation for MSFT.NB Across Models.
llama_insight: demonstrates the performance of various models in estimating the variance of Microsoft's stock price (MSFT) over time. It shows how different models can capture the volatility dynamics differently and highlights the importance of selecting appropriate modeling techniques when analyzing financial data. semantic distillation  the scientific insight,  this figure.
llava_insight: presents a comparison of variance estimation for the MSDFT. NB stock using the LSTM-BEKK model and several benchmark multivariate volatility models. The LSTM-BEKK model outperforms the benchmark models in terms of variance estimation accuracy.

dual_analysis.text_only_analysis: demonstrates the performance of various models in estimating the variance of Microsoft's stock price (MSFT) over time. It shows how different models can capture the volatility dynamics differently and highlights the importance of selecting appropriate modeling techniques when analyzing financial data. semantic distillation  the scientific insight,  this figure.
dual_analysis.vision_enhanced_analysis: presents a comparison of variance estimation for the MSDFT. NB stock using the LSTM-BEKK model and several benchmark multivariate volatility models. The LSTM-BEKK model outperforms the benchmark models in terms of variance estimation accuracy.

caption: MSFT.NB AAPL.NB (predominantly positive covariance).
llama_insight: shows the out-of-sample forecasts of the time-varying correlations between Microsoft and Apple stock prices. It suggests that these two stocks have predominantly positive correlation over time. Write a short sentence summarizing this figure's significance or relevance within the broader research context.
llava_insight: presents a comparison between the proposed LSTM-BEKK model and several benchmark multivariate volatility models. The comparison is conducted on high-dimensional portfolios constructed from the top 100, 175, and 250 equities by market capitalization in the United States, the United Kingdom, and Japan. The data is visualized through two line graphs, one for Microsoft (MSFT) and the other for Apple (AAPL), highlighting their predominantly positive covariance.

dual_analysis.text_only_analysis: shows the out-of-sample forecasts of the time-varying correlations between Microsoft and Apple stock prices. It suggests that these two stocks have predominantly positive correlation over time. Write a short sentence summarizing this figure's significance or relevance within the broader research context.
dual_analysis.vision_enhanced_analysis: presents a comparison between the proposed LSTM-BEKK model and several benchmark multivariate volatility models. The comparison is conducted on high-dimensional portfolios constructed from the top 100, 175, and 250 equities by market capitalization in the United States, the United Kingdom, and Japan. The data is visualized through two line graphs, one for Microsoft (MSFT) and the other for Apple (AAPL), highlighting their predominantly positive covariance.

caption: In-Sample Variance Estimation for AAPL.NB Across Models.
llama_insight: shows the variance estimation for Apple stock over time across different models. It highlights the accuracy and stability of the proposed LSTM-BEKK model compared to other benchmark models such as DCC-GARCH, VARMA-GARCH, and BEKK models. Methodology: This section presents the foundation models from econometrics and machine learning that form the building blocks for our proposed LSTM-BEKK model.
llava_insight: illustrates the in-sample variance estimation of the Apple (AAPL) stock price using a LSTM-BEKK model and several benchmark multivariate volatility models. The visualization shows the variance of the AAPL stock price over time, with the LSTM-BEKK model outperforming the other models, demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed model in accurately estimating the stock's variance. This finding supports the research objectives of evaluating the scalability and generalizability of the LSTM-BEKK model in high-dimensional portfolios, as well as its superior performance compared to existing models.

dual_analysis.text_only_analysis: shows the variance estimation for Apple stock over time across different models. It highlights the accuracy and stability of the proposed LSTM-BEKK model compared to other benchmark models such as DCC-GARCH, VARMA-GARCH, and BEKK models. Methodology: This section presents the foundation models from econometrics and machine learning that form the building blocks for our proposed LSTM-BEKK model.
dual_analysis.vision_enhanced_analysis: illustrates the in-sample variance estimation of the Apple (AAPL) stock price using a LSTM-BEKK model and several benchmark multivariate volatility models. This finding supports the research objectives of evaluating the scalability and generalizability of the LSTM-BEKK model in high-dimensional portfolios, as well as its superior performance compared to existing models.

caption: SCHW.N NEM.N (predominantly negative covariance with occasional reversals).
llama_insight: demonstrates the effectiveness of the LSTM-BEKK model in capturing the dynamics of covariance between two assets. It highlights the ability of the model to identify both long-term trends as well as short-term fluctuations in their relationship. US (highly correlated throughout).
llava_insight: is a line chart comparing the performance of a proposed LSTM-BEKK model against several benchmark multivariate volatility models on high-dimensional portfolios. The key scientific insight demonstrated in the chart is that the LSTM-BEKK model outperforms the benchmark models in capturing the complex dynamics of covariances, particularly in the SCHW. N portfolio, which shows predominantly negative covariance with occasional reversals.
